00023 #ifndef __NITF_TYPES_H__
00024 #define __NITF_TYPES_H__

00026 #   include <assert.h>
00027 #   include <stdlib.h>

00029 #   include <stdio.h>
00030 #   include <math.h>

00033 #   include <ctype.h>
00034 #ifdef WIN32
00035 #      define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
00036 #      include <windows.h>
00037 #      undef WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
00038 
00039 /*  Types are defined for windows here  */
00040 typedef unsigned char     nitf_Uint8;
00041 typedef unsigned __int16  nitf_Uint16;
00042 typedef unsigned __int32  nitf_Uint32;
00043 typedef unsigned __int64  nitf_Uint64;
00044 
00045 typedef signed char       nitf_Int8;
00046 typedef __int16           nitf_Int16;
00047 typedef __int32           nitf_Int32;
00048 typedef __int64           nitf_Int64;
00049 typedef HANDLE            nitf_IOHandle;
00050 typedef HINSTANCE         NITF_NATIVE_DLL;
00051 typedef FARPROC           NITF_DLL_FUNCTION_PTR;
00052 typedef DWORD             nitf_AccessFlags;
00053 typedef DWORD             nitf_CreationFlags;
00054 /*  Determine the maximum file path length  */
00055 #      define  NITF_MAX_PATH     MAX_PATH
00056 
00057 
00058 /*  IO macros  */
00059 #      define  NITF_INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE
00060 #      define  NITF_INVALID_HANDLE(I) ((I) == NITF_INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00061 #      define  NITF_SEEK_CUR         FILE_CURRENT
00062 #      define  NITF_SEEK_SET         FILE_BEGIN
00063 #      define  NITF_SEEK_END         FILE_END
00064 #      define  NITF_CREATE           OPEN_ALWAYS
00065 #      define  NITF_OPEN_EXISTING    OPEN_EXISTING
00066 #      define  NITF_TRUNCATE         OPEN_EXISTING
00067 #      define  NITF_ACCESS_READONLY  GENERIC_READ
00068 #      define  NITF_ACCESS_WRITEONLY GENERIC_WRITE
00069 #      define  NITF_ACCESS_READWRITE GENERIC_READ|GENERIC_WRITE
00070 
00071 /* type suffixes */
00072 #      define  NITF_INT64(x) x##i64
00073 
00074 
00075 #else
00076 /*
00077 *  Here, we define the basic libraries needed by
00078 *  all compilers (the non-platform specific code)
00079 *
00080 */
00081 
00082 #      include <unistd.h>
00083 #      include <errno.h>
00084 #      include <dirent.h>
00085 #      include <fcntl.h>
00086 #      include <sys/stat.h>
00087 #      include <dlfcn.h>
00088 #      include <inttypes.h>

00091 /*  Typedefs on Unix are a different ball game */
00092 typedef uint8_t            nitf_Uint8;
00093 typedef uint16_t           nitf_Uint16;
00094 typedef uint32_t           nitf_Uint32;
00095 typedef uint64_t           nitf_Uint64;
00096 
00097 typedef int8_t             nitf_Int8;
00098 typedef int16_t            nitf_Int16;
00099 typedef int32_t            nitf_Int32;
00100 typedef int64_t            nitf_Int64;
00101 typedef int                nitf_IOHandle;
00102 
00103 typedef void*             NITF_DLL_FUNCTION_PTR;
00104 typedef void*             NITF_NATIVE_DLL;
00105 typedef int               nitf_AccessFlags;
00106 typedef int               nitf_CreationFlags;
00107 /*
00108 *  Under Unix, we want to provide default permissions.
00109 *  Some are nice enough to default to 0666, others just
00110 *  burn you, so we make it explicit
00111 */
00112 #      define  NITF_DEFAULT_PERM  0644
00113 #      define  NITF_INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE -1
00114 #      define  NITF_INVALID_HANDLE(I) ((I) == NITF_INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
00115 #      define  NITF_SEEK_CUR             SEEK_CUR
00116 #      define  NITF_SEEK_SET             SEEK_SET
00117 #      define  NITF_SEEK_END             SEEK_END
00118 #      define  NITF_CREATE               O_CREAT
00119 #      define  NITF_TRUNCATE             O_TRUNC
00120 #      define  NITF_OPEN_EXISTING        0
00121 #      define  NITF_ACCESS_READONLY      O_RDONLY
00122 #      define  NITF_ACCESS_WRITEONLY     O_WRONLY
00123 #      define  NITF_ACCESS_READWRITE     O_RDWR
00124 
00125 
00126 /* type suffixes */
00127 #      define  NITF_INT64(x) x##LL
00128 
00129 
00130 
00131 /*
00132 *  On most systems, this gets included in limits.h, but sometimes its not
00133 *  there, so we make one up.  I figure we can easily get 1k on the stack,
00134 *  so if its not there, it gets set to that.
00135 */
00136 #      if defined(MAXPATHLEN)
00137 #          define NITF_MAX_PATH      MAXPATHLEN
00138 #      else
00139 #          define NITF_MAX_PATH      1024
00140 #      endif
00141 #endif
00142 
00143 
00144 
00145 #   define NITF_SUCCESS  (1)
00146 #   define NITF_FAILURE  (0)
00147 
00148 
00149 /* Enum for the supported version types */
00150 typedef enum _nitf_Version
00151 {
00152     NITF_VER_20 = 100,
00153     NITF_VER_21,
00154     NITF_VER_UNKNOWN
00155 } nitf_Version;
00156 
00157 
00158 /* These macros check the NITF Version */
00159 #define IS_NITF20(V) ((V) == NITF_VER_20)
00160 #define IS_NITF21(V) ((V) == NITF_VER_21)
00161 
00162 
00163 /*
00164  *  Finally, we determine what kind of system you
00165  *  are using, and come up with our own swap routines.
00166  *  This is to avoid the nasty mess that comes with
00167  *  (Unix actually) the non-standard socket include locations,
00168  *  and to avoid including sockets just to swap bytes (Ugh).
00169  */
00170 
00171 /* these functions are accessed if needed via the nitf_ntohs
00172    and nitf_ntohl macros defined in System.h                 */
00173 
00174 NITFPROT(nitf_Uint16) nitf_System_swap16(nitf_Uint16 ins);
00175 NITFPROT(nitf_Uint32) nitf_System_swap32(nitf_Uint32 inl);
00176 
00177 #   ifdef WORDS_BIGENDIAN
00178 #       define NITF_NTOHL(x) (x)
00179 #       define NITF_NTOHS(x) (x)
00180 #       define NITF_HTONL(x) (x)
00181 #       define NITF_HTONS(x) (x)
00182 #   else
00183 #       define NITF_NTOHL(x) nitf_System_swap32 (x)
00184 #       define NITF_NTOHS(x) nitf_System_swap16 (x)
00185 #       define NITF_HTONL(x) nitf_System_swap32 (x)
00186 #       define NITF_HTONS(x) nitf_System_swap16 (x)
00187 #   endif
00188 typedef void NITF_DATA;
00189 #endif
